H0.text: Reflects sunlight is why the Moon's surface is visible to an observer on Earth.

H1.text: Absorbs light from Earth is the reason the Moon's surface is visible to an observer on Earth.

H2.text: The Moon produces its own light, which is why its surface is visible to an observer on Earth.

H3.text: Transmits sunlight is why the Moon's surface is visible to an observer on Earth.

A4.text: Light scattering by the regolith causes the Moon to appear much brighter at full moon than at quarter phases.

A5.text: The Moon has only a minuscule hydrosphere, atmosphere, and magnetic field.
